title: Conditionals: Second & Third
description: Слушайте нереальные условия настоящего и прошлого.

tasks.audioText: My sister dreams about living abroad. If she spoke fluent French, she would move to Paris immediately.
tasks.transcript: If she spoke fluent French, she would move to Paris immediately.

options.text: She speaks French fluently and is moving to Paris.
She doesn't speak French well enough, so she can't move to Paris right now.
She moved to Paris last year.
She will learn French next month and then move.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional: if + past simple, would + base verb. This describes an unreal present situation — she doesn't speak French fluently.

tasks.audioText: Jake regrets not studying harder at university. If he had studied more seriously, he would have graduated with honours.
tasks.transcript: If he had studied more seriously, he would have graduated with honours.

options.text: He studied hard and graduated with honours.
He didn't study enough, so he missed the chance to graduate with honours.
He is studying seriously right now.
He will study harder next semester.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: if + had + past participle, would have + past participle. An unreal past — he didn't study hard, so he didn't graduate with honours.

tasks.audioText: Money is always tight in our household. If we had more savings, we would renovate the kitchen this year.
tasks.transcript: If we had more savings, we would renovate the kitchen this year.

options.text: They have enough savings and are renovating the kitchen.
They don't have enough money, so the kitchen renovation isn't happening.
They renovated the kitchen last year.
They will definitely renovate next month.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional expressing an unreal present — they lack sufficient savings, so the renovation is hypothetical.

tasks.audioText: The accident was a terrible experience. If the driver had been paying attention, the crash would not have happened.
tasks.transcript: If the driver had been paying attention, the crash would not have happened.

options.text: The driver was attentive and prevented the crash.
The crash will happen in the future.
The driver was not paying attention, which caused the crash.
The driver always pays attention while driving.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: the driver wasn't attentive in reality, and the crash did happen. The sentence imagines a different past outcome.

tasks.audioText: Lisa loves animals but has a small flat. If she lived in a house with a garden, she would adopt two or three dogs.
tasks.transcript: If she lived in a house with a garden, she would adopt two or three dogs.

options.text: She lives in a house with a garden and has dogs.
She adopted dogs last year.
She doesn't live in a house with a garden, so she can't adopt dogs now.
She will buy a house next week and adopt dogs.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional for an unreal present — her flat is too small, so adopting dogs remains a hypothetical wish.

tasks.audioText: The startup failed after only six months. If the founders had secured more investors, the company would have survived.
tasks.transcript: If the founders had secured more investors, the company would have survived.

options.text: The founders found enough investors and the company is thriving.
The company failed because it didn't have enough investment.
The company will find investors next year.
The founders had too many investors.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: in reality, the founders didn't secure enough investors, and the company didn't survive.

tasks.audioText: I sometimes wonder about career changes. If I were a professional musician, I would travel the world performing concerts.
tasks.transcript: If I were a professional musician, I would travel the world performing concerts.

options.text: I am a professional musician and travel for concerts.
I imagine being a musician and touring globally, but it's not my reality.
I was a musician in the past.
I will become a musician next year.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional with 'were' — an imaginary present scenario. The speaker is not a professional musician.

tasks.audioText: We talked about the missed opportunity all evening. If we had bought that house five years ago, it would have doubled in value by now.
tasks.transcript: If we had bought that house five years ago, it would have doubled in value by now.

options.text: They bought the house and its value doubled.
They didn't buy the house and missed a profitable investment.
They are buying the house right now.
The house lost all its value over five years.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional expressing regret — they didn't purchase the house, and it would have been a great investment.

tasks.audioText: Mark works overtime almost every day. If he didn't work so many hours, he would spend more time with his children.
tasks.transcript: If he didn't work so many hours, he would spend more time with his children.

options.text: He works reasonable hours and sees his children often.
He works too much, which prevents him from spending time with his kids.
He stopped working overtime last month.
He doesn't have any children.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional: the reality is he works too many hours, so spending time with children is only hypothetical.

tasks.audioText: The patient's recovery was slower than expected. If she had followed the doctor's advice from the start, she would have healed much faster.
tasks.transcript: If she had followed the doctor's advice from the start, she would have healed much faster.

options.text: She followed the doctor's advice and recovered quickly.
She ignored the medical advice initially, which slowed down her recovery.
The doctor never gave her any advice.
She will follow the advice starting tomorrow.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: she didn't follow the advice in reality, resulting in a slower recovery than possible.

tasks.audioText: Public transport in our city is unreliable. If the trains ran on schedule, fewer people would drive to work.
tasks.transcript: If the trains ran on schedule, fewer people would drive to work.

options.text: The trains run on time and fewer people drive.
Trains are not punctual, so many people prefer to drive instead.
Nobody drives to work in this city.
The trains will start running on time next week.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional: in reality, trains don't run on schedule, which is why people drive. The punctual scenario is hypothetical.

tasks.audioText: The team lost the championship by a single point. If the goalkeeper had saved that last penalty, they would have won the trophy.
tasks.transcript: If the goalkeeper had saved that last penalty, they would have won the trophy.

options.text: The goalkeeper saved the penalty and the team won.
The goalkeeper failed to save the final penalty, costing the team the championship.
There was no penalty in the match.
The team will play the championship next season.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: the goalkeeper didn't save the penalty, and the team lost. The sentence imagines a different past result.

tasks.audioText: Emma wishes she could help more. If she had more free time, she would volunteer at the animal shelter every weekend.
tasks.transcript: If she had more free time, she would volunteer at the animal shelter every weekend.

options.text: She has plenty of free time and volunteers every weekend.
She doesn't have enough free time to volunteer regularly at the shelter.
She volunteered at the shelter last year but stopped.
She dislikes animals and never volunteers.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional: she lacks free time in reality, making regular volunteering only a wish, not a fact.

tasks.audioText: The negotiations collapsed last month. If both sides had shown more flexibility, they would have reached an agreement.
tasks.transcript: If both sides had shown more flexibility, they would have reached an agreement.

options.text: Both sides were flexible and signed an agreement.
Neither side was flexible enough, which caused the negotiations to fail.
The negotiations are happening right now.
Only one side refused to negotiate.

tasks.explanation: Third conditional: both sides lacked flexibility in reality, and the negotiations failed as a result.

tasks.audioText: I sometimes think about what life would be like. If I could travel back in time, I would choose to visit ancient Rome.
tasks.transcript: If I could travel back in time, I would choose to visit ancient Rome.

options.text: I can travel back in time and I'm going to Rome.
I visited ancient Rome in the past.
Time travel is impossible, but if it weren't, I'd go to ancient Rome.
I will visit modern Rome next summer.

tasks.explanation: Second conditional for a completely hypothetical scenario — time travel is impossible, making the wish entirely unreal.

short_description: Нереальные условия: второй и третий тип.
